t: They Have Afflicted Me from My Youth
“Greatly*pn have they afflicted me from my youth”— let*ld Israel now say—
“Greatly*ln have they afflicted me from my youth, yet*ld they have not prevailed against me.
The*ln plowers plowed upon my back; they*ld made long their furrows.”
The*ln Lord*s is righteous; he*ld has cut the cords of the wicked.
May*ln all who hate Zion be*ld put to shame and turned backward!
Let*ln them be like the grass on the housetops, which*ld withers before it grows up,
with*ln which the reaper does not fill his hand nor*ld the binder of sheaves his arms,
nor*ln do those who pass by say, “The*ld blessing of the Lord*s be upon you! We*ld bless you in the name of the Lord!”*s
